item.title: [317] How to add a teleport command
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

You’re just showing us how to copy and paste an if-statement. And your conventions aren’t great. It’s not sufficient enough to be considered a tutorial, sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] How to add a teleport command
item.dc:creator: @excel4 excel4
item.description:
@excel4 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:5, topic:355446”][quote author=excel4 link=topic=451999.msg3312472#msg3312472 date=1282076135]

[size=18pt][/size]I added your tut and I got 100 errors help![size=18pt][/size]

No but really, the current snippet would throw 100 errors due to a missing bracket. Also, it would be wise to use equals or equalsIgnoreCase instead of startsWith. And to top it all off, this is common sense and too short to be considered a tutorial.

Okay, it is because you forgot to put in a bracket. At the end of the command, put a }
[/quote]
Fixed in quote ;)[/quote]

Oh lol Didn’t catch that there. I fixed the bracket issue people might have by mentioning it twice in the post. Thanks for pointing that out. :o

Read full topic

item.source: [317] How to add a teleport command

item.title: [317] How to add a teleport command
item.dc:creator: @excel4 excel4
item.description:
@excel4 wrote:

Hello, my name is Excel4 and I am going to tell you how to make a teleport command.

Difficulty - 1/10
Edited Files - Client.java

Ok let’s get right to the point. Let’s say you want to make a staff zone on your server and you want to make a command to teleport to that spot. In your client.java , use ctrl + f and search for if(command.startsWith

Next, paste under the last command there,

if (command.startsWith("staff") && playerRights > 0) { toX = xxxx; toY = xxxx; }

Change “staff” to what you want people to say to be able to teleport to the location. Also, change playerRights to whatever you want (e.g. playerRights >= 1) that will make it playerRights 1 or higher.

Finally, change both of the “xxxx” to the cordinates you want them to teleport to.

Now compile and have fun with teleport commands! I hope this helped. Feel free to ask any questions. ;D Make sure you answer the poll and don’t forget to put a bracket " } " at the end of the command list or you will get 100 errors while compiling!

Read full topic
item.source: [317] How to add a teleport command
